result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian A Torres was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Mail Fraud - Take or Receive Any Matter/Thing Sent/Delivered by US Mail or Commerical Carrier [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.89(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 16CF14 and the prison sentence he is now serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  Thereafter, to be paid monthy, through extended supervision.   If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.   If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  Thereafter to be paid monthly, through probation.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.   If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Obtain and maintain employment.  Continue to pursue high school diploma or it's equivalent, if not already completed.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with the victim.  

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

Defendant to be subject to random drug testing by his agent.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: same as prison sentence.

records.addlTxt: Amendment to judgment of conviction- CIP.  DOC form
From DOC along with Order for Amendment to JOC - CIP.  Letter and proposed orders sent to Judge.
of 8/1/16 plea/sentencing hearing
destroyed

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Poss.  16CF15. State supplemented Count 1 language, in the complaint and information.  Attorney Poss agrees with that.  Victim notification complied with.  16CF14: $112.81 restitution.  $29.00 Restitution in 16CF15.  Defendant plead to 16CF14. Forgery.  16CF15 plead to Count 1.  Remaining counts in those cases were dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Priors confirmed by the court.    Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the counts he plead to. Felony warnings given.   Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of forgery, contrary to 943.38(1) and mail fraud, contrary to 943.89(3).   Joint recommendation for:  Concurrent with sentences now serving.  4 -1/2 years total.   18 months initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision.  Eligible for SAP and CIP.  No credit.  Both concurrent to each other.  

Court ordered:   4 -1/2 years total.   18 months initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision.  On each case, concurrent.  Also concurrent with sentences now serving.  Eligible for SAP and CIP.  No credit.  Pay restitution.  CC.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Subject to random testing by his agent.  o/m employment.  Pay monthly through probation.  Continue to work on HSED GED if not completed.  No contact with the victims.  DNA sample and surcharge.
Waive reading of the information.  Plead to 16CF14. Forgery.  16CF15 plead to Count 1.
Information filed with the court.
